title: Terms out for property fund manager Primewest's IPO
text:
Real estate fund manager Primewest is seeking to raise $100 million at $1 a security for its initial public offering.

Broker Moelis and Shaw and Partners sent terms to potential buyers on Wednesday.

The deal would value Primewest at $349 million on a market capitalisation basis and 18.4-times profit, based on proforma 2020 financial year forecasts.

The IPO shares represented a 29 per cent stake in the company.

The brokers will run an institutional bookbuild on Thursday to sell the IPO stock.

Potential investors were told Primewest is an Australian real estate funds management business that was founded in 1995 and manages $3.9 billion of assets across 75 funds and seven asset classes.
description: Real estate fund manager Primewest is seeking to raise $100 million at $1 a security for its initial public offering.
